Description: A Greek 'Omega', roughly fashioned from metal. Bandits will not hassle you.

Tooltip: A neccesity for travel between colonies
Description: Fuel is the lifeblood of traders, never leave port without first checking your tank.
The bare minimum to keep someone running for a day

Tooltip: Tasty, but spoils without proper storage
Description: A rarity in a good portion of the world, which makes is quite valuable to the right people.
Raising livestock is an expensive process. Meat is highly valued.
Helps with maintaining machines. Wear and tear means you need a replacement once in a while.
Uncommon tech allows these patches to conduct repairs autonomously, but burn out performing the job
Consumes fuel to generate power. Vital for survival.
Goes nice with a finely tailored outfit. Good luck finding one
What most things are built out of these days
Good for making something new or fixing something old
Durable material for building more than a shack.
A low caliber firearm, useful for defense. Not very effective against armoured targets.
Armor meant to protect from the typical bandit raid.
Let anyone who intends to raid you severely regret their choices for a whole second.
When it comes to healing, simple herbs and some cloth are better than nothing.
Bandages, medicine and a suture kit to treat injury and illness.
Stocked with the best medical supplies and drugs, easily applied by even an unskilled user.
Advanced equipment used in hospitals to operate on patients.

Tooltip: Raw ore used in steel production.
Description: With the right amount of carbon content, raw iron can be refined in a Steel Mill.
It's wet.
Knives are fine, but avoiding metal flakes in your soup is better.
Useful for a variety of tasks, from securing items to tying up bandits.

Tooltip: Good for seeing in the dark.
Description: It's seen better days, but gets the job done.
Useful for staying warm, and ensuring a good night's sleep
Has a corkscrew, scissors, a knife, and several screwdrivers.
They're fuzzy.
Provide resistance against cuts, as well as heat resistance.
Can be used to chop items, or enemies.
The bedrock of any human society.
Very rare and powerful medicine - quite valuable.
Essential for cooking any sort of meal.
Useful for powering small items, such as flashlights.

Tooltip: Follow "N" to go to the North Pole.
Description: Useful back when Earth had a strong magnetic field, but is now a collector's item.

Tooltip: The label says this is highly flammable.
Description: Came from a barbecue, should be handled with care.
This treasure chest has every tool you could ever need.
Useful for starting fires, but has a limited number of uses.

Tooltip: Starts fires, and looks cool too.
Description: Useful for starting fires, and can be refuelled
A surprising lack of corrosion, and looks like it still holds charge.
A book with a plethora of survival knowledge.
Useful for digging, and can double as an impromptu weapon
An assortment of painkillers, sure to help you forget all your woes.
Motors are used in farming equipment, mining machines and vehicles.
This scientific data is indecipherable to you, but an expert may value it.
This scientific data is indecipherable to you, but an expert may value it.

Tooltip: Blueprints for an old rocket engine.
Description: Bring this to a factory and they may be able to build it.
The Standard Model Field Tri-Recorder can measure a wide variety of environmental conditions.
This locket has been in your family since before the Shattering. Along your long travels it remains a piece of home.
This large, expensive machine is used to lift large quantities of molten steel.

Tooltip: Powerful enough to blast to the stars.
Description: A new engine built from century-old blueprints.
Excellent collector's piece, for the right buyer.
Art from before the world ended. Nostalgic.
No Signal' reads the screen. You aren't sure how it's still powered.
A rifle from an old war. You can't tell exactly which one.
A functioning entertainment console is a luxury indeed.
"The hair, the colours, the pants! People can�t afford to care about this anymore."
You aren't sure if there's a working record player left on the planet.
